intro: Saccoloma imrayanum, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a member of the family Menispermaceae. It is a climbing shrub characterized by its slender stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically clustered in axillary inflorescences. Its fruits are fleshy berries that turn red when mature, containing several seeds. The botanical features of Saccoloma imrayanum make it an important species in its native habitat, though it is not widely cultivated.
